messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Oh my God, there's a dead man in a car on Forest Circle!
You're on Forest Circle? What happened?
I don't know exactly. I just found him, please hurry!
Okay, hold on a second. What's your name?
My name is James. Please hurry!
Can you tell me more about what happened?
I shot the guy. He was going to kill me. I had to do it.
Alright, hold on just a second. What's your name?
James.
Where are you right now? Are you in Corbin or Williamsburg?
I'm in Corbin, up on the hill on Forest Circle.
Is the man still there with you? Is he okay?
No, he's shot. He's dead. I killed him.
Okay, hold on. Stay on the line, I'm going to transfer you.
Corbin Dispatch.
Hello, this is James.
What's your emergency, James?
I just shot a guy on Forest Circle. He threatened to kill me, so I shot him.
Alright, where exactly are you on Forest Circle?
I'm up on the hill at 11034 Forest Circle.
What's your name?
Bill Cox.
Why did you shoot him?
He's been hitting my daughter. He threatened to kill me. I had no choice.
What's his name?
Ryan Abner.
Can you still see him?
No, he's dead.
Where's your gun now?
I gave it back to the neighbor.
Where exactly are you right now?
I'm in my white truck, parked near the house.
Okay, I’m going to let the officers know. Stay on the line.
Alright, thank you.
How long ago did this happen?
About five minutes ago.
How many times did you shoot him?
I think just once, in the head.
Alright. I've informed the officers, they're on their way.
Okay. He's been beating my daughter and I couldn't take it anymore.
I understand. Stay calm, they're almost there.
Okay. I'm sitting in the truck, waiting for them.
When the officers arrive, keep your hands where they can see them, and follow their instructions.
Alright, I will.
Are you walking outside now?
Yes, here they are.
Go ahead and hang up once you're with them.
Okay, hanging up now.
